revised_title: Electrochemical Influence of Long-Continued Electric Currents of Low Tension
tldr: The author, Golding Bird, conducted experiments on the electrochemical influence of long-continued electric currents of low tension. He found that weak electric currents could decompose certain saline combinations and reduce metal oxides, such as copper, lead, and tin. Bird also developed a new apparatus to provide a continuous and equal current of low intensity for his experiments.
